Sw1N3Srs0E16Pl9vZ1WxfQ.text: Very good burgers! There is a great selection on their menu, so there's something for everyone's preferences. My favourite is the Camemburger with camembert, hash brown, truffle mayo, onion jam, relish, and brioche bun.

pCTF6HXFDV6s5Ae5Mo5DOw.text: Pricy, but great burgers, chicken and the skinny fries are great. Free water is a nice plus. They know how to cook a burger medium versus well done.If you like place and will go back get their app and then you'll get free food and if you go to the same location over more than 10 times you'll get 25% for a month.

BmjnpGw55I5StHZLAYgzgA.text: Good all-around burger joint.  Not quite as delicious as I was expecting, but not bad, either.  The milkshakes were very good, and the chocolate chips mixed in the chocolate milkshakes were a really nice touch!  The chunky fries were just average.I wasn't a really big fan of the style of ordering, though.  It's a weird mix of a sit-down restaurant and fast-food.  They should choose one or the other.

OMG9qNiyI0aycmFahVI8ew.text: Modern and Hip little place. Delicious burgers at a fair price. Friendly servers. Free water carafes and peanuts. Would rate it 5 stars but the corn we ordered was charred black on one side and pretty dry.But otherwise great  the Frenchie burger was a delight!

qT7p73ZHT6v3BRLIxW-Fug.text: Good Burger but slightly overcooked. Brioche Bun fell apart while eating. Really okay for a quick bite!

O9u6oCmrIgOQCghmHjYhlA.text: Decent burger chain.LA is one of America's premier burgertowns in the premier burgercountry. That said, I wasn't too disappointed with the quality here and theres one big reason why I've kept coming back.I got the 'cheese" which is just a cheeseburger. They have many more interesting options including the "Babaganoush"-Peter's secret recipe with mashed aubergines blended with tahini & spices and the "Kiwiburger"-beetroot, egg, pineapple, cheese, salad, mayonnaise & relish among others.The meat was nice, thick and of high quality. They cooked it just as I ordered it at medium.However there were two things that turned me off. The cheese was just not that flavorful, and what flavor it did had was quite peculiar. It was "aged cheddar" instead of american or sharp cheddar most american burgers come with. Secondly, the bun had all sorts of seeds and flavors on it that made it more like an "everything" bagel than a normal burger bun.The real reason why I really like this place is not that they have awesome burgers, but that they have a card for 40%(!) off all food for students. A great deal and a great reason why I will be heading here even though I miss the quality of In N' Out, The Apple Pan, Father's Office, The Library, Umami, the Habbit and others back in LA.

K3CVi-tMjEEowRRzSRRLCA.text: Been here in the UK a few weeks.  This was the 1st restaurant where the service was rude and the food was poor, I guess good luck ends at some point.The salad was nice, but the burger was brought out right after ordering (pre-made?)  After pointing out that I had ordered a cold dish (starter salad) and a hot dish, could they have said it would all come out in 2 minutes?  They said they do it that way (like McDonalds? pre-made?)I wolfed down my salad, which was lovely with my red wine (a bit skunky, but not too bad otherwise).  By the time I finished the salad, the burger was rock hard.  I asked again if they could fix this mistake.  They said it wasn't a mistake and finally took it (without my permission) and threw it on the grill.  It ended up as rubber texture, which was inedible unless you like super well done.  Finally, I ate none of it and asked once again if they would fix it or remove it, the manager said no.  I said, please take a bite and tell me it is good and I will happily pay.  She wouldn't, in spite of my not eating it at all.  Finally, I paid and left to buy a proper burger with good service at Byron's, about 5 blocks away at Cromwell and Gloucester.

djbNhk2455RmfPrmtE_xcQ.text: Fresh and quality hamburgers with nice fries homemade.A nice restaurant however a bit cold in winter, really should turn on the central heat. However, a very pleasant moment spent in this restaurant. the waiters are very nice also.

C-MUESEJXNw4bf-dcZkIJg.text: Accidentally found this place when all of the pubs in the area stopped serving food at 10pm. We tried 2 of the 4 veggie burgers on the menu and they were some of the best we've ever had. Love "the Billy" especially. Skinny Rosemary fries and dipping sauces are also worth the stop. Would come here all the time if we lived in England.

cd1bDasKxN1qV9_g55fj2g.text: Good burgers.  Open late.The name says it all:  gourmet burgers.I had the blue cheese (with Stilton dressing) and it was super tasty.  Plus the chunky fries.  The burgers were artfully designed.  I wish I saved my photo but I was really hungry that evening.The place was hopping!!

K-kGCjMcPk1UD76YpUC9Qw.text: Tasty, pricey burgers.We tried this place in the advice of an ex-pat living in the neighborhood.  We were looking for a quick bite before our flight & were told the burgers here are huge and delicious so we stopped in. You go up to the counter, order your burger & beverage then choose your seat.  I had a delicious bacon & avocado turkey burger.  The burger was quite large and definately filling, the chips were pretty lame however.If you feel like a big burger with a bunch of topping options & don't mind parting with a few extra £'s for lunch this isn't a bad place.

LSEbyG1cvWBRUZhih7FH6Q.text: Everything at GBK was absolutely satisfactory  the staff were pleasant, the cheese & bacon burger did all the things you'd expect a cheese & bacon burger to do, and at £9, the price was definitely surmountable. Nothing about the experience really stood out, though, and despite the wide selection, presentation and general attention to detail, our evening at the Gourmet Burger Kitchen was lacking a certain je ne sais quio. On the other hand, maybe that's needlessly negative  because there was certainly nothing wrong with food, service, or decor. I guess it's just that when you're as spoiled for choice as you are in London, any restaurant that doesn't make you long to go back will get left in the lurch.

Xn0QSLqykHj8AostSOHJBg.text: I had the spicy Burger, fries & a chocolate shake. Everything was great except the shake was not chocolatey enough. It wasn't bad but I've had better shakes. The spicy burger was really good, and lived up to it's word of being spicy. I ordered it medium rare and it was cooked as such. The service here was good. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The total meal came out to £14.90, a bit pricey. I would definitely come back again and recommended this place to others.ADDENDUM: I went to wash my hands in the restroom after the meal and I saw an employee come out of the toilet and leave the restroom without washing his hands. He could have washed them upstairs but that's kind of GROSS. Down from 4 stars to 3 for that.

jcrKAe9y6He0jWvQKrBl7Q.text: I had heard a lot of good things about this chain of quality burger places so I had to try it for myself.I have to say I am a bit mixed about the whole thing. The decor of the restaurant is fine - simple but modern. Service was good. Burgers looked very impressive....But they just did not taste that special. The meat was a bit chewy; they dont ask you how you want it cooked - which I would have thought is a must for a quality burger.Chips were fine but nothing to rave home about.It was ok. But no WOW factor.

GWCtrvsO6vLdCwVgS4W23Q.text: Quality burgers at a quality price. GBK offers some of the best burgers around and they're massive, usually too big to pick up. The service is always good, order & pay directly at the till. GBK is all about the burgers, I rarely bother with chips. I would recommend the Kiwi or Mexican burgers. Look out for the printable online 2for1 vouchers often available on weekdays

iGMFbKM4q8pD0Zkvl3_qAg.text: Gourmet Burger Kitchen has ok burgers. The burgers are quite average tasting. They look good and they are huge and made to look good but they are not as good as I would expect from a reastaurant named GOURMET BURGER Kitchen. The meals are around £7 for a burger which is pretty good. The staff are always very helpful and friendly to make a really great experience.

QsL8FJpp2FK3WDW-wAGozA.text: Looking for a burger the size of a small child? Then Gourmet Burger Kitchen is the place to go. I originally hail from the US, a land known for its overindulgence and I was soundly defeated by the burger I had here. What's great about GBK is the variety of fixin's available for your burger. The standard lettuce, onions, pickles, etc but every different type of cheese, mushrooms, sauces, etc. They do good work here and the fries were top notch.

tBTCi38qqw1J6C8fpByu1g.text: This is a spot that is so cool to stop and eat. It also has a take away portion as well. It was a juicy burger and the sweet potato fries were crispy. It is order first and pay, and then sit down. It is a cute, authentic place and a great place to grab a burger. It was cool to see how Kensington does burgers.

W7i1cd0cphWTKvTMVNfF7w.text: This place was awesome!  I rarely enjoy the food in London and walking around Earl's Court, my co-worker and I had a difficult time deciding if we were going to eat at GBK, but I'm really glad we did!The burger patty was awesome here.  Very flavorful and cooked to perfection.  The toppings were fresh and interesting.  This is set up similar to a lot of the new wave of restaurants in the US where you order your food at a counter, get assigned a number, pick a seat, and then eventually someone brings out the food.The dining room isn't large, but seats a number of people and the decor is really clean, modern but warm.  We camped there for awhile as we had arrived to London that night and were not yet used to the cold weather coming from Southern California.  No one made us feel like we needed to leave, and the place did get quite full.A great burger if you're in the area.  I'd certainly return.

DNkJYCkTDsEXT9d9GcicRw.text: Very Nice Location !The Burger was GooD (fresh meet and tasty Bun) it was realy tasty the Only Problem is the Price .. But ok its London .

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

p-u9Fd6YS23MQsJf0dOWXA.text: So pleasantly surprised with this place! The burger is one of the best I've had in recent memory - the GBK bacon and cheese cooked medium well. The onion rings were obviously homemade and extremely tasty. Try the blue cheese mayo for an extra kick with them.

z3nEMziIK9MCzRFN3I8t3w.text: Starting off London with a bang! Delicious burgers excellent service and great food quality. The chips are out of this world! Now only if they could make a poutine with these chips back home this would be lethal.They have a bunch of homemade mayos which is awesome.The burgers range from 5-10 and they have a special lunch menu as well.Friendly and lovely spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Avacado bacon burger best burger I've ever had
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

sP6anVkRhtuWpdQk1JqdAw.text: I bookmarked GBK before we left home for our vacation to London thinking we might get homesick for a burger while away. It's our last night in London and we've been all over this town and enjoyed a variety of delicious food. We decided to check this place out tonight and it did not disappoint! My husband had the classic cheeseburger and loved it, but I had the Californian veggie burger and it was OUTSTANDING. I do eat meat, but I love a good veggie burger now and then and this one is the best I've ever had. Such care and attention to detail with a perfect combination of flavors! We also shared an eggnog shake and it was excellent. Highly recommend this place to locals and foreigners alike!

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

u6Lw-r_LkmIy1-4ii7dtZA.text: Right before catching a flight to the US, I found myself craving a burger in the worst way!  It was going to be a long flight, so a good meal beforehand seemed prudent.I'm something of a burger aficionado, so my bar was probably set overly high.  That said, Gourmet Burger Kitchen has an impressive selection of burgers, with some excellent choices; you'll doubtless find something here you like.  The burgers are made using the "more is better" principle - they're piled high, and you need to be careful when eating yours to avoid getting burger flotsam and jetsam all over you.I got bacon on my burger, and it wasn't crispy at all.  That works for some people, but not for me.  Further, the burger was fairly bland and under seasoned; but it looked great and had a wonderful mouth feel going down.  The chips they served with it were exceptional, so no complaints on that score.  The small salad I got to round out the meal was fresh and very good, so I declare my pre-flight meal an overall success!I'll doubtless feed my burger Jones further in California, but for now it was satisfied and ready for a long pull across the Pond ;-)

l4_56rMxqVKvbGfF2T6evQ.text: ...they serve burgers but their burgers taste different. Taste British!!! not American!!! Their burgers are good if your are homesick (if you are American traveler) or you don't want having pub food, other than that if you walk a little further you can find other options... ;)Servie wise you have to sit yourself, choose your burger from the menu which left on the table, go to the counter and place your order. Servers bring your food to you!!! So it is not full table service.

S4o-BSnUSIVQ7bX8zTfdhg.text: Had the California burger which consists of avocado, fried black bean patty, cheddar, red onions, mayo, relish, lettuce on a brioche bun. It was probably one of the best veggie burgers I've had due to the the tasty fried black bean patty. It didn't taste too greasy and felt unexpectedly light. Along with that we shared a GBK salad and chunky fries. Both nice. The workers do well clearing out tables in a timely fashion for the next party and orders brought out promptly. We arrived right at dinner time and all tables were occupied so it did feel a bit tight. If I turned around I was uncomfortably close to our neighbors plate so when we left and I turned around to grab my purse hanging off my chair, I felt intrusively close. This is my second visit to this chain and we left with our bellies full and very satisfied.

OuX3wpb26lXjvFpk_q1rmQ.text: I had the Cajun blue burger and the flavors are absolutely amazing. The staff is friendly and the service is fast. I would recommend this to tourists and locals alike

A04lgcMOReWXWj40lxduqA.text: My family and I really enjoyed eating here. The burgers were good! And perfect size. I also really liked the fizzy drinks and free refill. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Soda in glass bottles and lemon grass & ginger fizzy drink with complimentary peanuts

aM1-IrfoCXs738RzisC8Qg.text: This is a great burger...  the best part of the meal was the truffled cheese fries!!!!  They are awesome with great truffle flavor.  The roasted corn was not so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Truffled cheese fries!  Awesome
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

vXQo5b8aauvlquP3tW0Qow.text: I had the BACON PESTERELLA with a side of sweet potatoes.. OMG !!!!!!This is the best burger I have eaten ever ever...amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. BACON PESTERELLA

X6Hqu5WIrsG0XXPweJHXYQ.text: Visiting from the US my wife kept passing this place on our way to the hotel so we decided to stop in and eat. What a pleasure , my wife had the hamburger which she ordered with Orion rings. It was good . I ordered the chicken which was moist and fresh . I will definitely recommend this place to others. Carlos took great care of us and explained our different options to us.

MM2zjGi5n336y9cQOR7LOg.text: Great spot for afternoon lunch. Enjoyed a camembert & cranberry sauce grilled chicken with fries and a nice cold ginger beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Chicken Camembert & Cranberry - Camembert, cranberry sauce, house mayo, relish, salad
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Lzjh5w-KvGXyV1Y12uK00A.text: Great burgers, the meat was perfectly cooked. Quick and nice service. Loved the chocolate milkshake. I recommend !

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

0Vp6H8-pQ8DHg6_Dk_i0nA.text: Staff was very friendly, music wasnt to loud and the burger was good. Meat: perfectly cooked and very tasty. The sauces was AMAZING! We had the smoked chili mayo and baconaise, both where very good!! Skinny fries and chunky fries: both chrispy and tasty. Only minus was the buns, they didnt taste homemade, but all together it was very good. Have to mention the strawberry and elderflower fizz: soooo good!!! And u get free refill!

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Yummy burgers!!!!

X-1kM28VozIgpiC3uK2syA.text: My god how much I liked this place. The burgers were just outstanding! So good. I also tried the veggie burgers and they were amazing as well. The one I tried was the California, and it didn't disappoint. It's was good, tasty and light at the same time. Loved it. They also serve really good onion rings, crispy and sweet. So so tasty. The place is kind of small and so are the tables, which makes me think that this place could use some restructuring to renovate the interiors. Once you are handed the menus you have to go at the counter and tell the waiter what you would like to order. I guess this could be kind of a bummers since you have to stand up and go to the counter every time you want to order something. Also everything must be paid in advance. I don't really like it when it's like that. But besides these last things: my god this is a place to try out. Can't wait to go back.

TnXb8GU0PIzcKWdmZpO5fw.text: Before my trip I'd already looked at some online menus and I liked Gourmet Burger Kitchen's one s on the last day of my trip I decided to have a go.After entering I was asked wether I'd been before and they explained that you had to go upto the bar for ordering. After looking at the menu I opted for a cheeseburger(got to choose between 3 types of cheese&got to shoose how I wanted my burger(well done), chips with garlicky mayo, onion-rings and a banana milkshake.I was free to then take some water and nuts whilst waiting for the food to arrive. The milkshake came pretty quick and it was delicious. But rather huge, whilst I was able to finish the lovely burger once it had arrived I left about half of the chips&onion rings. Was tempted to ask for a doggy bag but felt too embarrassed to do so. Still lovely food and would happily go back, but next time I'll probably just have a burger&a milkshakeOh whilst you had to pay for the garlicky mayo(and other sauces) the ketchup was free

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. banana milkshake. mmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. cheeseburger well done

dRys5AqzZYKY6Ap69t4bpw.text: Ya may need to undo yer belt a couple notches for this place; Burgers,  Milkshakes and Fries!!! Big and Bloody (anyway you like 'em)... surprisingly classic but a great find in London.They'll top off the burger with a pile of bacon and a fried egg. ..  totally delicious and absolutely NOT good for the waste-line. .. :)Biggy Yum-Factor
